body.name: Phone and Tablet Holder for Concept 2 Rowing Machine, Adjustable Tablet Mount Made for C2 Model C&D Rower ONLY, Compatible with Tablets & Phones & iPad Up to 11” Screen Size
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Friday, February 16 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Wednesday, February 14. Order within 5 hrs 27 mins
features: READ Before Order: This mount does not work with E-devices with case protection, Please remove the case protection of your phone or tablet first when using. CHECK PIC2 BEFORE PURCHASE PLS!!!!!

- COMPATIBILITY, Check pic2 before purchase pls!!!!! Fit original monitor arm with side slot ONLY(Un-modified Model C & D), Doesn't fit monitor arm without side slot(New RowErg or Modified C & D). A tablet or phone up to 11 inches will fit because the height of the stand is adjustable.

- Specially Designed For Concept 2, The tablet mount is made of premium material with fine coating instead of cheap 3D printing materials. It will become your perfect fitness partner and comfort your work outs.

- Easy to Install, Each package comes with an illustrated user manual. Follow the instructions correctly and everyone can be installed in less than a minute! The ultra-lightweight makes it a top choice for taking to the gym or using at home.

- Convenience of Use, This tablet mount holds your tablet in place and you can slide the tablet in and out from the side. With a small footprint, you can leave the tablet holders on when you park your concept 2 rower.
body.description: -- Compatible with C2 rower model C&D ONLY!Check pic2 before purchase pls!!!!!!Fits tablets or phones up to 11 inches.-- Does not work with E-devices with case protection.Please remove the case protection of your device first before using.-- Requires monitor arm to be vertical.Reinforce your monitor arm if it will fall down pls.We offer a 30 days money back and a 12 months quality warranty to all consumers. For any questions, you are welcome to contact us at any time.Friendly and easy-to-reach customer service to solve your problems timely.

productInformation.value: 3.8 3.8 out of 5 stars 80 ratings 3.8 out of 5 stars

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best tablet holder for concept2 rowing machine in my opinion
reviews.reviewText: TL;DR: buy this one if you use a concept2 machine in the gym instead of owning one at home or if you don’t want to pay the extra $15 for the official one from concept2. I rowed for years. I watch YouTube/Netflix on my iPad whenever I row long sessions (>45 minutes). So I have tried multiple tablet holders for concept2 during these years.The first one was from an individual seller on eBay. It cost me $19. It is 3D printed but without any padding, so the place it touches the tablet is quite slippery. I have to stick some foam pads on it to prevent my iPad from sliding off, but the friction is still less than optimal. So I avoid using it during short interval sessions when the machine shakes a little bit. Pros: it at least can hold a tabletCons: slippery, not so steady, not very well-made. The second one was from Concept2, which comes with a new machine manufactured after mid-2021. I brought my machine before that and it did not come with that official tablet holder. So I brought this holder myself. It costed me $35 ($25 + $10 shipping). It is the best among all three. It holds the tablet very steady. It also does not require the monitor arm to be strictly vertical, so it is easier to reach PM5 while sitting on the seat. The only downside is you have to replace your hold monitor arm with its new arms, so you cannot bring this holder with you if you go to a gym. Pros: Steady, easy to put the tablet on and off, PM5 still reachable with it installed. Cons: expensive, need installation, you cannot bring it with you to use on a public machine.The third one is this one. It cost me $18 (I have prime). It is molded plastic instead of 3D printed, so it feels more premium and grabs the monitor arms more steadily. It also has silicon mats, so the tablet won’t slide horizontally. I would say that it fixed every complaint I had with the first one I got. And I carry this one with me when I row in the gym instead of at home. Pros: Steady, easy to use and install, you can take it to any machine you useCons: monitor arm need to be vertical, so PM5 is slightly harder to reach

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2023
Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I could not believe how miniature this thing is when this arrived! This belongs to a doll house, nevertheless I decided to give it a go, and install per instructions. The corner piece broke off as I was trying to attach this holder to the rowerI’m glad it did - would it break with phone or tablet in it - that would result in a broken device.Seriously - don’t spent money on this junk, for what this is it does not cost more than 99 cents.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Best available mount for Concept 2
reviews.reviewText: Like everyone, I was looking for a tablet mount for the concept 2. It's easy to install and works well, so it has that. But ultimately you'll need to charge your phone or tablet so you'll need to take out of the holder and that's where all the problems are. You have to take it apart to remove the device and put it back together once charged. It's not hard and doesn't take too long but it's not instant like all the other spin bike holders that expand to hold your device.Since starting to row i don't spin anymore and I use my spin bike mount instead as it right next to it. I have a dedicated older tablet I use for the concept 2. I only need to charge it once a week and it's annoying enough that I use my spin bike holder instead. Oh well. But if you are looking for a dedicated holder for the concept 2 this is the one to get. The arm is the concept 2 is too big for a spin bike mount, so this is the best available.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 22, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Stable and secure
reviews.reviewText: It’s very stable and fits nicely. I just wish it was adjustable in some way so I didn’t need to take the case off to use it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Elegant design that works well.
reviews.reviewText: The cost seems quite expensive for what you get but I've got to admit it's a very elegant design that does the job!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Might be the best pad holder for your concept 2 rower
reviews.reviewText: Top quality with a reasonable price!I row on Concept2 rower for 7 years and had dozens of different pad holders, but this one is probably the best I’ve ever used.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2023
reviews.reviewText: If, and this is a big if, carefully hang the bracket and keep the controller arm stable and perfectly positioned, this would work. But really it’s bad, and to make matters worse nothing here should cost more than $1 USD. That’s it.This could be so easily printed here, in country, but that’s too much. Actually this product is literally all that is wrong with domestic manufacturing.No quality, cheap, and even as such couldn’t be made here. Just get C2 hanger. It’s great.

reviews.reviewTitle: Does the job. Mounted on our rower just fine.
reviews.reviewText: You get what’s expected. It’s a tablet holder.
